name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation
mission: PROVIDE SHELTER,CLOTHING,FOOD TO POOR AND THE NEEDY PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD.
theoryOfChange: The website describes service delivery aimed at easing suffering through healthcare, education, and social welfare; examples include providing free treatment for those who cannot afford it, operating schools to break barriers to education, and welfare centers extending services to people at their door-steps.
zakatClaimEvidence: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc. is listed as "Zakat eligible". Their donation page explicitly offers a "Zakat" donation option. A PayPal donation page also states, "Use this donation for Zakat Sadaqah Donation". Furthermore, their website features a dedicated "Zakat" section and mentions "Edhi Foundation's Ramadan Zakat Appeal". (Source: https://edhi.org/albaraka-bank-pakistan-ltd/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 38/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: The amal score rationale states that the impact score is tempered by a lack of third-party cost-per-beneficiary data. However, the impact score is also affected by the excessive working capital and minimal board governance, which should be mentioned for completeness.
Website shows related EIN (11-3454067), likely parent/subsidiary of 11-3013369
Evaluation source domain 'apps.charitycommission.gov.uk' is not a known trusted evaluator
Evaluation source domain 'openaccess.iku.edu.tr' is not a known trusted evaluator
Extremely high working capital (120.5 months) may indicate hoarding or data error

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc shows strong alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc. is listed as "Zakat eligible". Their donation page explicitly offers a "Zakat" donation option. A PayPal donation page also states, "Use this donation for Zakat Sadaqah Donation". Furthermore, their website features a dedicated "Zakat" section and mentions "Edhi Foundation's Ramadan Zakat Appeal". (Source: https://edhi.org/albaraka-bank-pakistan-ltd/)

all_citations.claim: The charity provides donation options and is considered zakat-eligible.
The foundation reported Total Revenue of $5,752,945, a program expense ratio of 95.1%, and holds 120.5 months of working capital.
The organization's programs include the High Ways Project, Ambulance Service, and Educational Services.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor values, though its impact score is tempered by a lack of third-party cost-per-beneficiary data.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific impact metrics for the High Ways Project
Reliance on a high volume of working capital relative to annual program output

dimension_explanations.alignment: This charity is ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE and shows high donor fit for those prioritizing religious and cultural causes [1]. The foundation's track record is established through its diverse service offerings, including ambulance and educational services, which address urgent humanitarian needs [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct service model with a program expense ratio of 95.1%, indicating that nearly all revenue is spent on its core missions of food, shelter, and emergency services [2]. While the foundation maintains a significant 120.5 months of working capital, specific evidence regarding the long-term outcomes of its educational and highway programs remains limited in public filings [2][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides critical humanitarian relief through a highly efficient financial model that directs the vast majority of funds to direct services.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.1%, ensuring most funds reach those in need
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 120.5 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing shelter, clothing, and food to impoverished individuals globally [2]. The organization operates specialized programs including an ambulance service, educational initiatives, and the High Ways Project [2][3]. In the most recent fiscal period, the foundation reported a Total Revenue of $5,752,945 [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with donor values, though its impact score is tempered by a lack of third-party cost-per-beneficiary data.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="9">over 120.5 months of working capital</cite>, which may suggest a need for a more aggressive deployment plan to address immediate humanitarian needs.
While program delivery is direct, there is <cite id="11">no public beneficiary data available</cite> to calculate specific cost-per-outcome metrics.

bbb_assessment.summary: Financial data indicates strong adherence to efficiency standards.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The foundation's massive asset base mitigates the risk of revenue decline in the short term.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">Declining revenue trend over the last three years</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="9">excessive accumulation of unrestricted reserves</cite> and a <cite id="18">3-year revenue CAGR of -4.0%</cite>.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly reliable; impact data is limited.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for Muslim donors as it <cite id="16">accepts Zakat</cite> and serves the <cite id="17">fuqara and masakin</cite> in Pakistan.

credibility.explanation: The foundation is highly credible due to its <cite id="8">75-year track record</cite> and its <cite id="13">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To enhance credibility, the organization could <cite id="14">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current 4 members to improve governance diversity.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by <cite id="2">95.1% program expense</cite> and direct service delivery in <cite id="15">ambulance and orphanage sectors</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact scoring would improve by <cite id="11">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for cost-effectiveness analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Clear theory of change but unverified outcomes

rich_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides critical humanitarian relief through a highly efficient financial model that directs the vast majority of funds to direct services.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the legacy of Abdul Sattar Edhi and want their funds to go 95.1% toward direct humanitarian services in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to support the world's largest volunteer ambulance network
Seek to fulfill Zakat obligations through a trusted Pakistani institution
giving_considerations: The organization is extremely well-funded with high reserves
Reporting focuses on activities rather than rigorous impact data
Revenue has seen a slight downward trend recently
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-growth startups or those who require RCT-level evidence of impact before giving.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: While the theory of change is clear, there is <cite id="11">no external evaluation</cite> of long-term outcomes for beneficiaries.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation provides immediate life-saving services (ambulances) and long-term support (orphanages) to stabilize vulnerable populations.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the high volume of services translates into permanent improvements in beneficiary lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the mission is vast, the charity already holds <cite id="7">$27.4 million in assets</cite>.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="2">95.1% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than most international peers.
similar_orgs: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on North American domestic needs
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

strengths.detail: The foundation directs <cite id="2">95.1% of its expenses to programs</cite>, ensuring maximum resource allocation to beneficiaries.
The organization operates with <cite id="6">$0.00 fundraising efficiency</cite>, meaning no donor funds are diverted to marketing or solicitation.
With a history <cite id="8">dating back to 1949</cite>, the foundation possesses over seven decades of experience in crisis response.

strengths_deep_dive: The foundation's financial health is characterized by an extraordinary level of liquidity, maintaining <cite id="9">120.5 months of working capital in working capital</cite>. This reserve allows the organization to remain operational during extreme economic volatility. Furthermore, the organization is governed by a <cite id="10">95.1% independent board</cite>, which provides oversight for its diverse service portfolio including <cite id="5">hospitals and children's services</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc is the international arm of Pakistan's most iconic humanitarian network, founded in 1949 by the late Abdul Sattar Edhi. The organization operates with a singular focus on <cite id="1">providing shelter, clothing, and food to the poor and needy</cite> globally, with a primary operational footprint in Pakistan. The foundation is distinguished by its <cite id="2">exceptional program expense ratio of 95.1%</cite>, a rare financial benchmark indicating that every dollar of public support is directed toward direct service delivery. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $5,752,945</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="4">$5,699,902 in public contributions</cite>. Its service model is comprehensive, encompassing <cite id="5">ambulance services, educational programs, and orphanage centers</cite> that serve as a critical safety net for underserved populations. Despite its massive legacy, the organization maintains a lean administrative profile, reporting <cite id="6">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, reflecting a reliance on organic community trust rather than traditional marketing. The foundation also maintains a massive liquidity position, holding <cite id="7">$27,427,805 in total assets</cite> against minimal liabilities, ensuring long-term stability for its essential humanitarian infrastructure.
